item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Active volcanoes in Guatemala never seize to stop amazing their visitors. They offer fun adventurers for all kinds of travelers. An invigorating natural activity you can do with the whole family while in volcano territory is to visit natural hot springs. Finding them in the towns that surround active volcanoes is very easy!

Natural thermal waters are rich in natural minerals and are a wonderful treatment for your skin. Even without mineral mud baths or body scrubs, your skin will be soft and radiant after a dip in a thermal pool.

Where to Do find Natural Hot Springs?

- Zunil/Quetzaltenango
- Livingston
- Atitlan
- Surroundings of Pacaya Volcano

The area around the Zunil Volcano and Santo Tomas Volcano is home to the most popular natural spa, Fuentes Georginas. Here you can soak in four pools of varying temperatures that are fed by hot sulfur springs.

If on the other hand you are traveling along the Caribbean coast of Guatemala ask about Finca Paraiso, a place where you can find natural pools and small waterfalls.

You won’t have trouble finding these warm pools in the towns around Atitlan Lake in Guatemala, since it is surrounded by volcanoes. Pacaya Volcano also provides the surrounding towns with thermal waters, you can even find a luxury spa close to it.

So, what is it going to be for you?

item.title: Quick Fold Stroller – Perfect for City Travel

item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Traveling with children can be challenging on many levels. For me the biggest test of all boils down to my baby’s needs. Or more specifically my need to keep him happy so I can enjoy my traveling. This all starts with what we call his ‘limo’ or better known as a stroller.  It took a while for him to get adjusted to being in one and now it’s our lifeline to a fun trip. However, the stroller he grew up with is a huge, all terrain baby jogger which is impossible to take to use as a city stroller where there is a lot of public transportation. It takes a good ten minutes to fold up and then takes up so much room that I can’t even fit it on a bus.  I desperately was in need of  quick fold stroller!

I’m not a huge fan of umbrella strollers, since with my first born we literally went through four different ones because they were so crappy. I needed the comfort of our large portable stroller but one that can be easily managed on city streets and can fold up in seconds.

You’ll be surprised that there are very few that fit these characteristics. You’ll either have only umbrella strollers or huge strollers that offer the comforts but not the ease.

That was until I found City Mini Single Stroller. 

My qualifications are really high so when I received this stroller I was expecting a lot out of it. Amazingly enough, it over-delivered all that it promises and so much more. To the point, it has now become the ONLY stroller we use traveling or not. The other stroller, which we’ve loyally used for almost three years, has now been placed in storage.

What I Love about our new Quick Fold Stroller

Package – It arrives in a thin package, right away a good sign it’s not going to take up too much.

Assembly – Putting it together was the fun part. And so easy – that it’s almost like ‘no assembly required’. Just a couple of quick clicks of the wheels in place and viola!

Quick Fold Technology – it’s soooooo easy. You just grab the inside strap that lays flat along the seat.

Then pull up and it’s folded. One hand! And bam it’s done.

Durability – the carriage can hold up to 50 pounds. However, we’ve already managed to test it on a number of occasions with my nine year old regressing to babyhood. And it can definitely hold the max weight capacity and more!

Brakes – the brake is at the bottom of the stroller and a quick stomp with your foot keeps it from going anywhere.

Compartments - the bottom has a huge storage area that can easily fit a baby bag or backpack and a lot more. Plus on the back of the seat is another handy pocket that can fit the essentials.

Sun Protection – we live in an extremely sunny place. We literally can not exist with out sunscreen and a sun canopy. This stroller has a large one that keeps my child completely covered with a small sun roof on top.

Reclining seat – you can have your child seated up straight, or almost in a laying down position.  The nob is easy to maneuver and secures in place.

Plus, you can have them totally reclined and see you from the back

And if you want them to sleep or it’s chilly out, there is a weather proof cover to place over it.

The Ride – this is one of the smoothest rides yet. It’s as though you’re driving in a twelve cylinder car. It feels like you’re floating along and the wheel in the front rotates easily and agilely to go with the pace and terrain.

Where to Buy It

They have tons of locations all over the world. I found the Baby Jogger website to be my best friend. I was able to read all about it, have help with questions, and quick and secure method of payment.


Quick Fold Stroller- Baby Jogger City Mini Stroller Review

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Planning a Vacation to Orlando Florida
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Planning a vacation is so much fun! You get to learn a lot about the place you are going to visit and if you start with enough time, it allows you to find the best places to visit and even some good deals.

Planning a trip to Orlando Florida is no exception. It is a big, modern city that is mainly targeted to tourism. It is also home to some of the most famous theme parks in the world. This means that in it you can find endless options for fun things to do, places to visit and places to stay.

However it doesn’t matter how may cool things there are to do in a city, if you don’t have the right accommodations for your needs, it just won’t be as good as it could. If you do some research you will discover tons of different lodging options in the city. There are huge resorts, boutique hotels, budget hotels and if you take your time, you might even find a villa in Orlando with your family’s name on it.

Now that you have found a place where you want to stay, it’s time to decide what places you want to visit. Most people will have as their main destination the Disney Parks. And for good reason, they are amazing! Something that you should know if you want to visit all 4 parks is that you will need around 5 days.

Some other cool places you can visit in Orlando are local water parks, shops, Sea World and of course the gorgeous white sanded beaches.

Now that you know the places you will visit and where you will stay, arrange your transportation. Do you want to drive? Will you hire a shuttle?

Last step, but the most important one is to try to stick to your plan, but keeping in mind that things don’t always go as you might want them to go. So just enjoy the ride!

item.title: Turtle Tours in Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Costa Rica is not only home to five species of sea turtles (Leatherback, Green Sea, Loggerhead, Hawksbill, and Olive Ridley) nesting on both the Caribbean and Pacific Coasts, but to three nesting sites that are some of the most important [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Costa Rica is not only home to five species of sea turtles (Leatherback, Green Sea, Loggerhead, Hawksbill, and Olive Ridley) nesting on both the Caribbean and Pacific Coasts, but to three nesting sites that are some of the most important in the world. Luckily for us, with such a strong turtle conservation movement to protect these animals that has been led by some of the best biologists, conservationists, and decitated park rangers, you can take guided turtle tours and watch these amazing creatures make their way to shore and lay their eggs. Let us arrange this magical experience for you.

This is where you can find Turtle Tours in Costa Rica:

The North Caribbean

Tortuguero National Park is the largest nesting site for the Green Sea turtle (Chelonia mydas) in the Western Hemisphere. In total the North Caribbean region there are just four species of turtles nesting on these protected beaches:

- The Green Sea turtles nest from July to October
- Loggerheads come in smaller numbers at the same time (July to October)
- The Leatherback (largest turtle in the world) arrives from March to May
- The Hawksbill’s season runs from March to October

Did You Know?

Female Green Sea turtles come back to their natal beach every two to three years. They nest several times in one season each time laying from 80 to 120 eggs. The eggs incubate for 60 days and you can watch the hatchlings make their way to sea.

The South Caribbean

Gandoca-Manzanillo Wildlife Refuge hosts four species of marine turtles: the Loggerhead, Green, Hawksbill, and Leatherback. For over 20 years the ANAI conservation organization has been a main component in protecting and researching the nesting habits of turtles in this region.

A bit further north in Cahuita, the Hawksbill sea turtles come to lay their eggs on Playa Negra from April to October.

The North Pacific

When the Olive Ridley sea turtles come to lay their eggs, they don’t come out one by one, but in huge waves known as “arribadas” which means “tens of thousands at a time”. The most popular place to see this phenomena is at the Ostional National Wildlife Refuge. If you’re in this area any time between the months of May thru December (peak months are August to October), you are almost guaranteed to spot a turtle on any night.

One of the five most significant Leatherback turtle beaches in the world is on Playa Grande at the Las Baulas National Marine Park. Between the months of October thru March you can sign up for a guided night tour and see this magical giant lay her eggs.

The South Pacific

Take a tour of Marino Ballena National Park and see the Hawksbill and Olive Ridley turtles lay their eggs anytime from May to November.

The majority of the turtle preservation projects are run by the Osa Sea Turtle Conservation in Drake Bay. Contact us if you want to take a great tour. There is an ongoing debate whether or not the Black turtle, which nests sporadically along the coast of the Osa Peninsula, is a sub-species of the Green Sea turtle, or its own species.

Insider Facts

Turtle numbers have been highly affected due to many factors, so for us to enjoy these creatures, on their home turfs, environmentally safe tours can be arranged with licensed guides or park rangers. Turtles are ultra sensitive to ambient light so cameras, video, or flash photography are strictly prohibited at night. The rangers and biologist are working hard for us to leave as little of a “footprint” as possible to keep the turtles coming back.


Things to do in Costa Rica – Turtle Tours

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Travel Hammock for Two – The Fun Has Just Begun
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:

item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Hammocks are one of those travel toys that everyone wants to have. So, when you are hopping around a tropical country and buy a hammock from the side of the road, all of a sudden you are weighed down with unnecessary weight all for the romance of carrying a hammock.  However, travel hammocks don’t have to be heavy. As a matter for fact, they can be one of the lightest things in your bag.

My kids are big hammock fans. The whole idea of swinging around while we’re chilling on some exotic island or enjoying mountain lodges makes their travel memories that much richer and fuller. The biggest problems with this is that not all places or hotels have hammocks, and if they do they can either be occupied or so dirty that I forbid it all together. Then the memory becomes ‘mama is bad’ and ‘no one let’s us play in the hammock’.

Finally, after too many of these silly problems popping up over and over again, I decided to do something about it.

I bought a travel hammock and haven’t looked back!

Finding the right one is a fun game in itself, since you’re preparing for your next trip and anything to do with an upcoming trip for me is just amazing!

I found it! The Eno’s Double Nest Deluxe Hammock. It’s a portable hammock for two! This way my two boys have no more excuses. Plus, it teaches them to share and bond – another huge facet of family travel.

Along with the hammock I also got the Atlas Hammock Suspension System. This way all I need are two poles, trees, or anything that will let me clip it on and swing about. And it takes up almost no space at all in my bags.

How the Hammock Suspension System Works

So easy you’lll wonder why all hammock ropes aren’t like this.

1. Attach it to a pole or tree and loop the rope into place. Remarkably, it really stays in place and doesn’t move.

2. Find the height that works best for your hammock – there are several loops that you can attach your hammock to for the best height. You can be as far off the ground as you want, or practically touching it.

5 Amazing and Unbelievable Features of Our Travel Hammock and the Hammock Suspension System

Weight – The hammock weighs 1.5 pounds and the suspension ropes less than one pound. In total this amazing toy is around 2.5 pounds.

Size – the hammock when it’s rolled up in it’s attached bag is about the size of a grapefruit. The straps look like two small, thick wallets.

Capacity and durability – the hammock and straps can hold up to 400 pounds. Even though it says it’s good for two people, but we’ve actually had a lot more in it. And if this thing can handle a bunch of crazy boys, you know it can handle anything!

Breathability – the whole allure of the side-of-the-road hammocks is that they are made of string with lots of breathing room. Personally, I’ll take the breathing nylon material over that any day, which is what this hammock is made of. I can’t stand the way my body falls through the holes on a regular hammock. The Eno hammock supports me completely.

Stuff sack – the sack to roll it up in is attached! It’s super super easy to simply roll it up and stuff it in.

 

My take on it

I’ll be honest with you. Even though my kids and husband love hammocks, I have been quite indifferent to them – BEFORE NOW. And I’m really not just saying that because my family has fallen in love with it. But because it really is awesome. It’s so tiny, that I can bring it anywhere with us for our travels. It makes my kids so happy and gives me free time. And when everyone is off doing their thing, mama gets her break to simply relax and enjoy the view!

Where to buy it

I found the Eagles Nest Outfitters website to be the best option. For one, the selection is huge. Two, they know what works best with all their products as for accessories. Three, you never know what deals are going on until you visit the site. Four, the customer service is great. Five, it’s easy.


Travel Hammock – Eagles Nest Hammocks Review

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: Why Holidays to Popular European Destinations Have Decreased – Where is Everyone Going?
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

The package holiday has been a staple for British people for nearly 50 years now, with many families opting to spend their time on the sun-soaked Spanish beaches, rather than the UK’s rain-lashed ones. However, package holidays have decreased in [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

The package holiday has been a staple for British people for nearly 50 years now, with many families opting to spend their time on the sun-soaked Spanish beaches, rather than the UK’s rain-lashed ones. However, package holidays have decreased in popularity, falling from 47 per cent of the market share in 2003 to just 38 per cent in 2009.

Five years ago, an increasing number of Brits seemed to be opting to travel independently, booking their own great value flights and hotels and choosing their own itineraries. Since then, the sector has seen another rise in bookings and in 2012 had risen to 43 per cent of the market share. However, with this rise in package holiday preference came a fall in bookings to the typical destinations.

So why have holidays to popular resorts in Spain, Greece and the Mediterranean decreased and where is everyone going now?

The original package bookers

A generation ago, foreign holidays were new for many. For the first time, mass access to air travel was possible, and the Spanish coast was hugely popular. Those with a bit more money and the taste for adventure opted for the Greek Islands or Portugal.

Soon, our horizons spread further – Greece and France where soon replaced by Florida.

The rise of the independent traveller

A perfect storm of cut-price international airfares, rising disposable incomes and the amazing window-on-the-world that is the Internet, facilitated access to such corners of the globe as were only previously only read about in National Geographic not long ago. Finding package tours were just not ‘adventurous’ enough anymore, travellers began booking independent trips to ever more exotic locations like Central America.

Holidaymakers no longer wanted to lounge in the sun, instead preferring to soak up some culture in a distant land, haggle for bargains in a busy bazaar and see the sun setting over a strange and foreign land. The package holiday was squeezed out and replaced by eco-tours and adventure trips, at least for those who could afford them.

The response of the travel industry

Package tour operators noted these trends and made a conscious effort to shift their offerings to more exciting destinations. Nowadays, it is almost as cheap to go to Latin America as it is to spend a vacation on the Costas, and if you aren’t bothered about the sun and sea, there are a wealth of places covered by the package providers that fall inland and still offer a cultural experience.

The holidaymaking population have responded wholeheartedly, particularly since the economic crisis of recent years. These days, people are returning to the package tour operators for last minute holidays and pre-booked trips, because they appreciate and desire the security that goes with having a big name company to take care of everything. So package holidays are on the up again – but the destinations we are choosing are often very different.

In the modern world, it is likely our tour operator will be whisking us off to Cuba or Central America, which is good news for them and great value for us.

item.title: Book Some of the Summer’s Hottest Cruises in 2013 to Get Away from Central America
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:

item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Taking a cruise is no longer the preserve of the ultra-rich. Cruises are now egalitarian affairs, a great number of which are family friendly. It is also a great way to have fun and experience different things from the ones you experience in Central America.

If you’re looking to get a head start on things and want to book your summer 2013 cruise, here are some of the hottest locations this year:

Mediterranean

If you’re new to cruises and you’re embarking on an adventure of this sort for the first time, the Mediterranean is a great starting point. Visiting Spain, Greece and Italy may not seem as exotic as some of the other possibilities on offer, but their proximity to England means travelling a shorter distance and there’s plenty to see and do; these Mediterranean destinations have much to offer in their own right.

Travelling with a company renowned for providing high-quality service, such as Co-operative family cruises, you can sleep soundly in the knowledge that your every whim will be catered to. From spacious living quarters, to fine dining and family-friendly entertainment, a cruise is an inherently relaxing experience.

The real fun, however, begins once you step onto dry land. Whether you’re exploring Barcelona’s famous La Rambla, enjoying the lively and artistic culture of the Gaudi quarter, standing in awe outside the Acropolis in Athens, or exploring the ruins of Pompeii close to Naples, a cruise is a chance to immerse yourself in European culture.

Venice

The romance of Venice continues to draw crowds and should be high on your list of cruise holiday destinations.

Venice has something for everyone: its medieval churches, domes, bell towers, palaces and piazzas provide the perfect setting for a romantic meal and evening stroll with your partner.

If you have kids, however, there’s no need to panic. A cruise to Venice in 2013 could be your opportunity to recapture the passion in your relationship, enjoying all that the city has to offer. All the while, you can rest safe in the knowledge that your kids are under the watchful eye of your ship’s counsellors, having a great time and making new friends as part of a dedicated youth programme.

Adriatic

Choosing to take a cruise in the Adriatic not only gives you the opportunity to see Venice, it also offers holidaymakers a chance to see some other truly fantastic sites.

The Croatian city of Sibenik is one of the prettiest seaside towns in the Adriatic. With a UNESCO protected church at its very heart, the 150 islands off its coast provide myriad stunning vistas, including the awe-inspiring waterfalls of Krka National Park.

Croatia’s delights continue to abound in the city of Dubrovnik. The cobbled streets and its 17th-century cathedral provide an air of romance and intrigue that will leave you spellbound, while the surrounding Elaphite Islands’ pine forests, beaches and olive groves provide a picturesque setting for the more adventurous explorer.

Your Adriatic cruise culminates in the relaxing area of Corfu. Dozing under the hot summer sun on the golden sands of Glyfada beach, is the perfect way to let your worries fade away as the sun sets on your trip of a lifetime.

item.title: Canopy Tour in Costa Rica
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Canopy tour in Costa Rica are the most popular activities in the country and is a ‘MUST DO’ activity! Aside from a great adventure ride, you get to see Costa Rica’s biodiversity at its best because a lot of it [...]
item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Canopy tour in Costa Rica are the most popular activities in the country and is a ‘MUST DO’ activity! Aside from a great adventure ride, you get to see Costa Rica’s biodiversity at its best because a lot of it exists in the canopy layer. Enjoy a combo package of zip-line, aerial trams, suspension bridges, and tarzan swings. Contact us to set up a great day for you!

While zip lining in Costa Rica, you get to visit amazing ecosystems and get the bird’s eye view of bromeliads, toucans, monkeys, and sloths. Plus, the panoramic view of mountain ranges, volcanoes, and oceans make for an unforgettable experience.

Cool places for a Canopy Tour in Costa Rica:

- Arenal / La Fortuna
- Monteverde
- Jaco

How Does It Work?

There are many types of canopy tours that you can go on. Some require that you just put on a harness, attach yourself to a cable, and zip from one platform through narrow tunnels of greenery to the other. Others involve more hiking along trails that have suspension bridges with plenty of stop and gos to absorb the surroundings.

If you’re the super adventurous type, get on the 3,280-foot long Superman “sensational cable” and feel like a true superhero for the day at 55 mph! No matter the speed, it is all the same: put on a harness, hook up to a cable, leave your fears on the platform, and zoom!

Tours like this can turn a nice vacation into an unforgettable adventure. So don’t think twice, pick the company that offers these adventure tours in Costa Rica and enjoy!


Fun Things to Do – Canopy Tour in Costa Rica

Written by Marina Kuperman Villatoro

item.title: 4 Things to do in Orlando
item.dc:creator: Marina Kuperman Villatoro
item.description:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

item.content:encoded:
Travel Experta - Central America Travel Expert -

Orlando is a modern city in the middle of Florida. It is famous for being home to some of the best amusement parks in the world. But there are tons of other fun things to do, and places to visit in it. So don’t limit yourself to the parks on your next vacation.

Here are 4 recommendations on things to do in Orlando:

visit the Beaches – Orlando is a modern city, surrounded by beautiful beaches. You can enjoy all of the amenities of a beach destination and still have everything that you may need from a city, just steps away.
Water Parks – The city is also packed with water parks for families and people of all ages. The weather is perfect for them almost year long.
Sea World – A visit to Orlando, Florida cannot be complete without a visit to Sea World. It is a place filled with fun exhibits and the famous show of Shamu the Whale.
Festivities – What do you want? Concerts, parades, music festivals, parades, film shows, food events? Orlando has it all! So make sure you do some research about the popular events in the Orlando Area that will take place during your visit.

These are just a couple of things that you can do in Orlando. I’m sure that if you don’t like these, you will find some others with just a tiny bit of research. So dare to be different!
